title: How to Manage Your Preferences on Your Xbox One

methods.name: Managing Your Preferences from the Xbox One Console

steps.headline: Go to My Games and Apps.
steps.description: Look at your Xbox One dashboard for the button that says “My Games and Apps”; select it with the A button. Your screen will change to your apps and settings.

steps.headline: Go under the “Apps” tab on the left side of the screen.
steps.description: This will list your apps on the right side of the page.

steps.headline: Open the Settings menu.
steps.description: Scroll over until you see a gear icon with the word “Settings” inside it. Tap the A button on it to open your Xbox One settings.

steps.headline: Click the “Preferences” button on the top right side of the page.
steps.description: This is where you will find your preferences for your Xbox One.

steps.headline: Set Notifications.
steps.description: Select the drop box that says “ Show Notifications,”  and set it to ON if you want to get your notifications to pop up on your Xbox One. Your notifications will include things like messages, friend requests, and so on. Allow Skype to stay on while you’re playing by clicking the Skype box. This is great for communicating with friends across consoles. Press the A button on Messages box if you want to get notified when new messages come to your account. This is especially useful if you are looking to hear from a friend about a game that you are playing. Selecting the Party option and picking “Yes” or “No” will allow you to get party notifications. It will tell you when someone leaves or joins the party. “Sign In and Broadcasts” is the final notification box. You can set your system to let you know when favorites, all friends, or no friends sign on. All you need to do is hit the A button on the box and pick your preference.

steps.headline: Pick your Systems and App settings in the middle column.
steps.description:
You can Allow the following for your systems and apps:
“Play for streaming,” which allows you to stream directly from apps such as Netflix and Hulu. “Allow broadcasts,” which lets you broadcast from Twitch. This is basically a parental feature. “Allow streaming from other devices,” which lets you stream what you are doing in your games from apps such as SmartGlass. All three options have check boxes. Select the ones you want to use by hitting the A button over the box by each option until you see a checkmark inside. You are able to pick all three if you want them to all be active at once. Essentially, they are for either parental control or data conservation.

steps.headline: Enable Smartglass.
steps.description: Select your final option, which is how your Xbox One handles Smartglass. Smartglass is a mobile app that interacts with your Xbox. You can choose between “Do not allow,” “Allow select devices,” and “Allow all devices.” Press the A button by the option that you choose to allow for your Smartglass.

methods.name: Managing Your Xbox Preferences from a Windows 10 Computer

steps.headline: Open the All Apps menu.
steps.description: Click the Start menu on the bottom left side of the screen, and from the list of programs and options, select “All Apps.” All the apps on your computer will be listed in alphabetical order.

steps.headline: Select Xbox.
steps.description: Scroll down to the letter “X” and you will see the green Xbox app. Select it by clicking on it.

steps.headline: Log into your Microsoft account.
steps.description: Do this by entering your email address and password on the login screen. Right-click the login button to load your account.

steps.headline: Open the menu.
steps.description: Click the box with 3 lines in it on the top left side of your Xbox app. You will see a list of options that you can click on.

steps.headline: Select the Settings box at the bottom of the menu under the box with three lines.
steps.description: Your Xbox settings will load on the screen where you can adjust Xbox preferences. On Windows 10, the options for preferences are limited; you can only adjust notification preferences for your Xbox.

steps.headline: Adjust Favorites notifications.
steps.description: Look under the top section that reads “Notifications.” The first box says “Favorites Online” with a checkbox by it. If you click this check box, your favorite friends will show up on your screen when they sign in.

steps.headline: Set Twitch broadcast notifications.
steps.description: Select the checkbox right below that which says “Twitch Broadcast Started” if you want to see when your friends are broadcasting on Twitch. This is great if you do not have the time to monitor your Twitch or friends list.

steps.headline: Turn on Messages notifications.
steps.description: Click the third check box that reads “Messages” if you want to get an Xbox One notification when someone sends you a message.

Your screen will change to your apps and settings. Go under the “Apps” tab on the left side of the screen. This will list your apps on the right side of the page. Open the Settings menu. Scroll over until you see a gear icon with the word “Settings” inside it. Tap the A button on it to open your Xbox One settings. Click the “Preferences” button on the top right side of the page. This is where you will find your preferences for your Xbox One. Set Notifications. Select the drop box that says “ Show Notifications,”  and set it to ON if you want to get your notifications to pop up on your Xbox One. Your notifications will include things like messages, friend requests, and so on. Allow Skype to stay on while you’re playing by clicking the Skype box. This is great for communicating with friends across consoles. Press the A button on Messages box if you want to get notified when new messages come to your account. This is especially useful if you are looking to hear from a friend about a game that you are playing. Selecting the Party option and picking “Yes” or “No” will allow you to get party notifications. It will tell you when someone leaves or joins the party. “Sign In and Broadcasts” is the final notification box. You can set your system to let you know when favorites, all friends, or no friends sign on. All you need to do is hit the A button on the box and pick your preference. Pick your Systems and App settings in the middle column. You can Allow the following for your systems and apps:
“Play for streaming,” which allows you to stream directly from apps such as Netflix and Hulu. “Allow broadcasts,” which lets you broadcast from Twitch. This is basically a parental feature. “Allow streaming from other devices,” which lets you stream what you are doing in your games from apps such as SmartGlass. All three options have check boxes. Select the ones you want to use by hitting the A button over the box by each option until you see a checkmark inside. You are able to pick all three if you want them to all be active at once. Essentially, they are for either parental control or data conservation. Enable Smartglass. Select your final option, which is how your Xbox One handles Smartglass. Smartglass is a mobile app that interacts with your Xbox. You can choose between “Do not allow,” “Allow select devices,” and “Allow all devices.” Press the A button by the option that you choose to allow for your Smartglass. Managing Your Xbox Preferences from a Windows 10 Computer Open the All Apps menu. Click the Start menu on the bottom left side of the screen, and from the list of programs and options, select “All Apps.” All the apps on your computer will be listed in alphabetical order. Select Xbox. Scroll down to the letter “X” and you will see the green Xbox app. Select it by clicking on it. Log into your Microsoft account. Do this by entering your email address and password on the login screen. Right-click the login button to load your account. Open the menu. Click the box with 3 lines in it on the top left side of your Xbox app. You will see a list of options that you can click on. Select the Settings box at the bottom of the menu under the box with three lines. Your Xbox settings will load on the screen where you can adjust Xbox preferences. On Windows 10, the options for preferences are limited; you can only adjust notification preferences for your Xbox. Adjust Favorites notifications. Look under the top section that reads “Notifications.” The first box says “Favorites Online” with a checkbox by it. If you click this check box, your favorite friends will show up on your screen when they sign in. Set Twitch broadcast notifications. Select the checkbox right below that which says “Twitch Broadcast Started” if you want to see when your friends are broadcasting on Twitch. This is great if you do not have the time to monitor your Twitch or friends list. Turn on Messages notifications. Click the third check box that reads “Messages” if you want to get an Xbox One notification when someone sends you a message.
